No executable scripts, network calls, or concerning patterns detected.

content.value_statement: React Server Components change how you build React apps by moving rendering to the server. This skill provides patterns and templates for Next.js 15 App Router including data fetching, Server Actions, and streaming for faster pages.
actual_capabilities: Create async Server Components with data fetching
Build Server Actions for form submissions and mutations
Implement streaming with Suspense for progressive loading
Configure data caching and revalidation patterns
Design component boundaries between server and client
Use advanced routing patterns including parallel and intercepting routes
limitations: Cannot use React hooks in Server Components
Client Components cannot directly import Server Components
Environment setup and deployment configuration not included

prompt_templates.title: Create Server Component
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an async Server Component that fetches posts from a database using Prisma and displays them in a list. Include proper error handling and type definitions.

prompt_templates.title: Build Server Action
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a Server Action that handles form submission with Zod validation, creates a record in the database, revalidates the cache, and redirects to the new resource.

prompt_templates.title: Add streaming
prompt_templates.prompt: Wrap a slow data-fetching component in a Suspense boundary with a skeleton fallback. Show how to stream independent components in parallel.

prompt_templates.title: Configure caching
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a data fetching function that uses fetch with caching options. Include examples for static data, ISR with revalidate, and dynamic data with no-store.

output_examples.input: Create a blog post listing page with async data fetching

Renders PostCard components with title, excerpt, author, and date

Metadata generated for SEO with post titles and descriptions

output_examples.input: Build a form that creates new posts with Server Action
output: Server Action validates input with Zod schema
Revalidates path to update cached data
Redirects user to new post page

best_practices: Keep Client Components at the edges of the component tree
Default to Server Components and only add use client when needed
Use Suspense boundaries to enable streaming for slow components
Fetch data in Server Components, never in Client Components with useEffect
anti_patterns: Using useState or useEffect in Server Components
Importing Server Components directly into Client Components
Passing functions, dates, or class instances as props between components
Making entire pages Client Components instead of targeted interactive islands

faq.question: Can I migrate incrementally from Pages Router?
faq.answer: Yes. Both routers can coexist. Keep pages directory and add new routes in app directory. Migrate route by route.

faq.question: How do I share state between Server and Client Components?
faq.answer: Use URL search params or cookies. Pass serializable data as props. Server Components can read cookies directly.

faq.question: What can I pass from Server to Client Components?
faq.answer: Only serializable data: strings, numbers, booleans, arrays, objects. Cannot pass functions, dates, or class instances.

faq.question: How does caching work with Server Actions?
faq.answer: Server Actions trigger revalidation with revalidatePath or revalidateTag. Use redirect after successful mutations.

faq.question: What causes hydration mismatch errors?
faq.answer: Using Date.now, Math.random, or browser APIs in Server Components. Add use client for components using these.

faq.question: How is this different from traditional SSR?
faq.answer: RSC runs only on the server with zero client bundle. Components are rendered on server and streamed without hydration.
